profile_positions.description:
Project leader and manager of a multidisciplinary project (physics, chemistry, formulation, physiology, pathobiology) focusing on using microbubbles and ultrasound for therapeutic applications (e.g. drug/gene delivery). 
- Maintaining relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
- Identifying external partners and creating an academic network.
- Manage external collaborations and contracts; support to Legal and IP departments.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead, Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description: Managing the Physics and Software Engineering department within the R&D site of Bracco Research Geneva. Allocating resources to the different R&D Projects according to priorities defined by upper management and considering the objectives of the Projects.
profile_positions.title: Head of Physics and Software Engineering Department, Senior Manager

profile_positions.description:
Directed R&D activities related to contrast-agent and software development as team manager in the Physics Department.

Responsible as project leader/manager of numerous activities in the field of ultrasound technology, bubble physics, microfluidics.

Involved in clinical translation of ultrasound molecular and functional imaging. Responsible for the technical development of dedicated solutions in 3D ultrasound acquisition, image reconstruction and post-processing, in the context of external collaboration.

Contributed as core team member to the  conception and development of software solutions for several indications in contrast-enhanced ultrasound imaging, both for research and commercial applications. Participated to the ISO 13485 certification and CE mark activities of a commercialized medical software product, sold across Europe (VueBox™).

Supporting external functions, such as Marketing, Intellectual Property, Legal, Medical & Regulatory Affairs, Life Cycle Management.

Supervising MSc and PhD students; defense committee member.
profile_positions.title: Team Manager, Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Specialist in ultrasound imaging technology, microbubble physics and quantification software applications.

Project team member involved in the design of a new generation of ultrasound contrast agent; responsible for defining acoustic characteristics.

Developing dedicated signal and image processing algorithms used for quantifying contrast-enhanced ultrasound data of numerous clinical indications (e.g. oncology, molecular imaging).

Authoring/co-authoring internal reports and scientific publications.

Active intellectual property development resulting in an extensive company IP portfolio on contrast-agent formulation and production, contrast-enhanced ultrasound imaging techniques, quantification methods, signal and image processing techniques.

Faculty member of workshops providing state-of-the-art overview on ultrasound and contrast-enhanced ultrasound imaging techniques to physicians (cardiologists, radiologists).
profile_positions.title: Ultrasound Physics Research Scientist
